Reviews.Title: Setup Screen Keeps Popping Up
Reviews.Author: SafetyThird
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV to replace a dead one for the bedroom. 26" is the perfect size as it doesn't light up the whole room in bright scenes. The amount of inputs is great, much better than the new panasonic plasma we got for the living room. Unfortunately that's all the good things I can say about the TV.Out of the box when I hooked it up to my antenna the setup screen comes on and even after going through and setting it up the screen keeps popping up. The unit has bad firmware. So bad that Seiki doesn't even offer an updated version to correct this problem. So after a few hoops I paid to send this unit back to Seiki. They promptly sent me back a brand new version of the same exact TV with the same exact problem. Why they would send a known broken unit as a replacement for a known broken unit is beyond me. I would stay away from Seiki like they were were the undead. If I have to pay to send this back again I'm going to be a good percentage of the purchase price into shipping around broken TVs. Unacceptable.

Reviews.Title: Don't buy from Seiki
Reviews.Author: S. Lewis
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV for my husband for Christmas because I thought it was a good buy.  Boy, was I wrong!  The channel scan menu pops up everytime the TV is turned on and off, additionally, while you're watching TV, another menu continually pops up and blocks the screen.  Seiki is obviously awasre of the problem and has a dedicated webpage just for firmware updates to fix it.  Unfortunately, this model does not have a firmware update online.  After being passed around to several call centers over a week, each with a different answer, I was finally told that I could have my TV replaced with another refurbished TV, but only if I paid to ship my broken (brand new) TV to Michigan.  Rediculous customer service!  I will never buy a Seiki product again, and do NOT reccomend this TV.  Buyer beware.

Reviews.Title: Its not that bad.
Reviews.Author: C. Dye
Reviews.Content: It's a pretty decent TV. The tuner does not seem to want to get digital channels but it does what I want it to.

Reviews.Title: Worse TV Ever !!!
Reviews.Author: Jim Lyman
Reviews.Content: To start with, this model lasted me 3 months,its completely burn't out,there is no support systemfor this company, nor is there any valid warrenty.I bought this from another company, a well knownsite,it was on sale.But Now I see this TV on Amazon.BEWARE BUYER !!! This is my second one,figuredmaybe it was a lemon,but 2 for 2 TV's ?? NOT !!!!! Angry doesn't even describe what I feelabout this company.It will cost more for me to ship it back,wait another 4 months for themto get around to fix it, and how long will it last after that ?? This company is a JOKE!SEIKI , YOU SHOULD BE ASHAMED ! I will make sure I post this all over many areas Seiki,thats a promise.From one very upset customer to Seiki, Amazon had nothing to do with this.Jimfrom NH.

Reviews.Title: 2 remotes needed to operate with my cable provider.
Reviews.Author: Mark Scott
Reviews.Content: It's a very nice television but I need to use the remote control it came with to turn it on and the remote that came with my cable provider to change the channels.

Reviews.Title: Stay away!!
Reviews.Author: Scott Birmingham
Reviews.Content: A TV, for the most part, is just a TV right?  Not this thing.  The worst part of it is that the remote control is composed of tiny buttons that are impossible to see or operate by touch--an unbelieveable oversight by the manufacturer.  Also the screen writing when you are setting something up, is so small it is hard to see.  Must be something to do with a market that has these TV's in a small room and the operator has tiny, tiny hands and has never seen a TV before.  WORST TV EVER.
